components.description:
A cup of a steaming-hot beverage, usually taken as coffee or tea. Sometimes shown on a saucer.

Samsung's design previously featured a foamy-white tulip latte art design.

May be paired with the Frog Face to represent the snarky But That's None of My Business meme. Relatedly, can also be used alone to represent "tea" as per the slang phrase "spill the tea", used to request the sharing of gossip, news, or personal information. More recently, it can also be used to refer to a person's physical attractiveness, as per the slang phrase "your body is tea."
components.title: Hot Beverage

description:

May be paired with the Frog Face to represent the snarky But That's None of My Business meme. Relatedly, can also be used alone to represent "tea" as per the slang phrase "spill the tea", used to request the sharing of gossip, news, or personal information. More recently, it can also be used to refer to a person's physical attractiveness, as per the slang phrase "your body is tea."
title: Hot Beverage

version.description: The following characters we added to Unicode in 2003 and given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: A hot beverage in a cup. Generally used as a tea or coffee emoji, but can be used as any hot drink. Hot Beverage was approved as part of Uni http://emojipedia.org/hot-beverage/
emoji_net_data.name: hot beverage

bn:00084038v: To foment or prepare, as by brewing; to contrive; to plot; to hatch.

bn:00087321v: To drink or imbibe with vigour or relish; to drink copiously; to swallow in large draughts.
To consume a liquid through the mouth.
To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.

bn:00014565n: Strong espresso coffee with a topping of frothed steamed milk
A drink of coffee prepared from one or two shots of espresso mixed with steamed milk and topped with foam.
A drink of coffee made from espresso and steamed milk, generally topped with foam.
A latte is a coffee drink made with coffee and steamed milk.

bn:00076266n: Tea is an aromatic beverage commonly prepared by pouring hot or boiling water over cured leaves of the tea plant, Camellia sinensis.
A traditional beverage made from steeping the processed leaves, buds, or twigs of the tea bush (Camellia sinensis) in water.
The drink made by infusing these dried leaves or buds in hot water.
Dried leaves of the tea shrub; used to make tea
Drink made from infusing boiling water with the leaves of the tea plant
The drink made by infusing dried leaves or buds in hot water.
Tea is an aromatic beverage prepared by adding cured leaves of the Camellia sinensis plant to hot water.
A dried fragment of a leaf of the tea plant used in making the drink tea.

bn:00020414n: A beverage consisting of an infusion of ground coffee beans
Served as a beverage without cream or milk.
Coffee is a brewed beverage prepared from the roasted or baked seeds of several species of an evergreen shrub of the genus Coffea.
Brewed beverage with a distinct aroma and flavor prepared from the roasted seeds of the Coffea plant
The seeds of the plant used to make coffee, misnamed ‘beans' due to their shape.
A flowering plant of the genus Coffea whose seeds are used to make coffee.
American coffee, as opposed to espresso, or a derived coffee drink (cappuccino, latte, iced coffee, etc.)

bn:00024410n: A concave vessel for holding liquid, generally adorned with either a handle or a stem
A concave vessel for drinking from, usually made of opaque material (as opposed to a glass) and with a handle.
A small open container usually used for drinking; usually has a handle
A cup is a small, open container used for carrying and drinking drinks.

bn:13603506n: A drink that is served hot.

bn:00010183n: Kind of liquid which is specifically prepared for human consumption
Any one of various liquids for drinking.
Drinks, or beverages, are liquids specifically prepared for human consumption.

bn:00028749n: A single serving of a beverage

bn:00014566n: Bitter, white crystalline xanthine alkaloid that acts as a stimulant drug
An alkaloid, C8H10N4O2, found naturally in tea and coffee plants which acts as a mild stimulant of the central nervous system.
A xanthine alkaloid found in the maté plant, stereoisomeric with caffeine
Caffeine is a bitter, white crystalline xanthine alkaloid and a stimulant drug.
A bitter alkaloid found in coffee and tea that is responsible for their stimulating effects

bn:00031614n: Espresso is coffee brewed by forcing a small amount of nearly boiling water under pressure through finely ground coffee beans.
Strong black coffee brewed by forcing hot water under pressure through finely ground coffee beans
A concentrated coffee beverage brewed by forcing hot water under high pressure through finely ground coffee.
Strong black coffee brewed by forcing hot water under pressure through finely ground coffee beans.
